intro: Mattiastrum lambertianum, commonly known as the Lambert's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, ribbed stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Mattiastrum lambertianum is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
